question.title: BasicRobot.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy() freezes indefinitely
question.body:
If I run these tests separately, they complete successfully.

However, if I run them all with mvn test, the one that happens to be executed later freezes indefinitely.

import org.fest.swing.core.BasicRobot;
import org.fest.swing.core.Robot;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeAll;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;

class RobotTest {

    static Robot robot;

    @BeforeAll
    static void beforeAll() {
        robot = BasicRobot.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy();
    }

    @Test
    void method_ifSomething_thenShouldDoSomething() {
        // no actual test
    }
}

// identical imports

class RobotTest2 {

    // identical content
}

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.easytesting</groupId>
            <artifactId>fest-swing</artifactId>
            <version>1.2.1</version>
        </dependency>

If I comment out the line that initializes the Robot in either of the tests, mvn test completes successfully.

    @BeforeAll
    static void beforeAll() {
//        robot = BasicRobot.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy();
    }

What could be the problem and how do I fix that?

The effect is present regardless of whether I execute the tests via IDEA or in Maven CLI directly.

answers.body:
It's a solution in that it solves the problem. However, I'm not sure it's how you're supposed to approach this.

    @BeforeAll
    static void beforeAll() {
        robot = RobotHolder.getRobot();
    }

import org.fest.swing.core.BasicRobot;
import org.fest.swing.core.Robot;

public class RobotHolder {

    private static final Robot robot = BasicRobot.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy();

    private RobotHolder() {
    }

    public static Robot getRobot() {
        return robot;
    }
}
